meanings.definition: To assign or credit to a different source or cause.
meanings.sent1: She was reattributing the success to her hard work.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reattributed the good grades to the students' effort.
meanings.sent3: By reattributing the painting to a famous artist, the value skyrocketed.
meanings.sent4: The detective was reattributing the crime to a different suspect.
meanings.sent5: Reattributing the discovery to the scientist made history more accurate.

meanings.definition: To transfer or allocate to a different person or group.
meanings.sent1: He was reattributing the responsibility to his colleague.
meanings.sent2: The manager reattributed the project to a more experienced team.
meanings.sent3: By reattributing the task, the workload became more manageable.
meanings.sent4: The company was reattributing the profits to various departments.
meanings.sent5: Reattributing the award to the deserving team boosted morale.
